title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (https:contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available https://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: Contributing to ramlegacy
text: Thank contributions! Following guidelines help streamline process contributing make sure ’re page. ask read guide follow best abilities, welcome contributions , regardless level experience. participating project, agree abide code conduct.

title: Contributing to ramlegacy
text: Following types contributions always welcome: Identify areas future development (open Issue) Identify issues/bugs (open Issue) Write tutorials/vignettes (open Pull Request contribute ones , make elsewhere send us link) Add functionality (open Pull Request) Fix bugs (open Pull Request)

title: Contributing to ramlegacy
text: Fork repository Clone repository GitHub computer e.g,. git clone https://github.com/ropensci/ramlegacy.git git remote add upstream https://github.com/ropensci/ramlegacy.git making changes make sure pull changes upstream git pull upstream changes beyond minor typos, add item NEWS.md describing changes add DESCRIPTION file contributor Push GitHub account Submit pull request home base (likely master branch, check make sure) ropensci/ramlegacy

title: Contributing to ramlegacy
text: general follow convention https://r-pkgs..co.nz/r.html#style (snake_case functions argument names, etc.) Use explicit package imports (.e. package_name::package_function) avoid @import possible

title: Introduction to ramlegacy
text: database’s website: RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database compilation stock assessment results commercially exploited marine populations around world. inspired Dr. Ransom . Myers’ original stock-recruitment database, longer updated.” April 2019, available versions 1.0, 2.0, 2.5, 3.0, 4.3, 4.40, 4.41, 4.44. latest versions database (4.44, 4.41, 4.40) available Zenodo. download_ramlegacy downloads database . older versions database (4.3, 3.0, 2.5, 2.0, 1.0) available Excel (Microsoft Excel Open XML Format Spreadsheet) format github repo.

title: Introduction to ramlegacy
text: goal ramlegacy cache specified version(s) RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Excel Database way save time effort spent re-downloading different versions database part future analysis involving data. package also supports reading specified dataframe(s) database function called load_ramlegacy(). user can always view location database cached read running ram_dir() specifying version argument. vignette outline details functions package hopefully make ramlegacy easy use.

title: Introduction to ramlegacy
text: can install development version github install_github function available devtools package: ensure vignette installed along package make sure remove ---build-vignettes build_opts install_github

title: Introduction to ramlegacy
text: can download available version RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Excel Database (“1.0”,“2.0”, “2.5”, “3.0”, “4.3”, “4.40”, “4.41”, “4.44”) download_ramlegacy(): version specified download_ramlegacy default downloading latest version database: want download multiple versions please download one time passing throw error. enable caching behavior, downloading specified version download_ramlegacy checks whether version already downloaded. download_ramlegacy gives user option either download overwrite existing version download just exit function. behavior modified overwrite, function argument download_ramlegacy, set true. even version already downloaded calling download_ramlegacy download overwriting already present version. downloading database download_ramlegacy caches converting RDS object can read calling load_ramlegacy(). download_ramlegacy also three arguments: ram_path, ram_url, quiet. default ram_path set location provided rappdirs package can viewed calling ram_dir(vers = "version"). Although recommended approach download_ramlegacy supports downloading user-specified path. ram_url fixed zenodo URL database. Please pass url ram_url. default, download_ramlegacy called keeps user updated download progress status messages. Setting quiet TRUE enables user suppress status messages.
code: # download version 1.0 download_ramlegacy(version = "1.0")  # download version 2.0 download_ramlegacy(version = "2.0")  # download version 2.5 download_ramlegacy(version = "2.5")  # download version 3.0 download_ramlegacy(version = "3.0")  # download version 4.3 download_ramlegacy(version = "4.3")  # download version 4.44 download_ramlegacy(version "4.44") # downloads latest version (currently 4.44) download_ramlegacy()

title: Introduction to ramlegacy
text: section illustrates contents file structure directory database saved call download_ramlegacy downloaded multiple versions download_ramlegacy() contents ramlegacy directory (path directory can viewed calling ram_dir()) local computer look something like version getting subdirectory within directory: ramlegacy directory structure older versions (1.0, 2.0, 2.5, 3.0, 4.3) contents version subdirectory look like : older version subdirectory structure older versions, version subdirectory contain excel database serialized database saved names RLSADB v <version > (assessment data ).xlsx v <version number> .rds respectively. newer versions (4.40, 4.41, 4.44) along excel file database file documents like stock summary files also downloaded: newer version subdirectory structure actual excel file database serialized rds database present RLSADB v <version > (assessment data ).xlsx v <version > .rds respectively inside DB Files Assessment Data folder.

what: Description of Tables and Stock Summary Files within the Database
title: Introduction to ramlegacy
text: description dataframes present database well information stock summary files present database please see page.

title: Introduction to ramlegacy
text: load_ramlegacy can used obtain list particular dataframes passed tables argument. get list dataframes within specific version database set tables = NULL. Make sure version want load downloaded already present locally path specify using ram_path otherwise load_ramlegacy throw error. case want load multiple versions please load one time passing throw error. Similar, download_ramlegacy, load_ramlegacy ram_path argument set local directory specified version RAM Legacy Stock Excel Assessment Database downloaded. can view path ram_dir(vers = "version"). Although recommended approach load_ramlegacy supports reading database’s dataframes user-specified path provided database present specified path rds file.
code: # returns a list containing area and bioparams tables from version 4.44 database load_ramlegacy(version = "4.44", tables = c("area", "bioparams"))

title: Introduction to ramlegacy
text: see path directory specified version database downloaded user’s computer, user can call ram_dir. Note also location load_ramlegacy reads database. example, see version 4.3 database downloaded can call:
code: # view the path where version 4.3 of the database was cached ram_dir(vers = "4.3")

what: Description of the dataframes present in the database:
title: Tables and Stock Summary Description
text: metadata: Table summarized metadata (available newer versions starting v4.40) stock: stores stock database table assessment: stores assessment database table taxonomy: stores taxonomy database table management: stores management database table assessor: stores assessor database table assessmetod: stores assessmetod database table area: stores area database table biometrics: stores biometrics database table tsmetrics: stores tsmetrics database table timeseries: time series data matrix object following headers/columns: (1) assessid (2) stockid (3) stocklong (4) tsid (5) tsyear (6) tsvalue bioparams: parameter data matrix object following headers/columns: (1) assessid (2) stockid (3) stocklong (4) bioid (5) biovalue (6) bioyear (7) bionotes timeseries_values_views: stores timeseries values timeseries type along columns stocks along rows timeseries_units_views: stores timeseries values timeseries type along columns stocks along rows timeseries_ids_views: stores timeseries IDs timeseries type along columns stocks along rows timeseries_assessments_views: stores timeseries assessments timeseries type along columns stocks along rows timeseries_notes_views: stores timeseries notes timeseries type along columns stocks along rows timeseries_sources_views: stores timeseries sources timeseries type along columns stocks along rows timeseries_years_views: stores timeseries years timeseries type along columns stocks along rows bioparams_values_views: stores reference point values, reference point type along columns stocks along rows bioparams_units_views: stores reference point units, reference point type along columns stocks along rows bioparams_ids_views: stores reference point IDs, reference point type along columns stocks along rows bioparams_assessments_views: stores reference point assessments, reference point type along columns stocks along rows bioparams_sources_views: stores reference point sources, reference point type along columns stocks along rows bioparams_notes_views: stores reference point notes, reference point type along columns stocks along rows

what: Newer Versions (v4.40 onwards) also contain tables of individual most-used time series:
title: Tables and Stock Summary Description
text: tb.data: Total Biomass ssb.data: Spawning Stock Biomass tn.data: Total Abundance r.data: Recruits tc.data: Total Catch tl.data: Total Landings recc.data: Recreational Catch f.data: Fishing Mortality er.data: Exploitation Rate divtb.data: TB/TBmsy divssb.data: SSB/SSBmsy ivf.data: F/Fmsy diver.data: ER/ERmsy divbpref.data: B/Bmsypref divupref.data: U/Umsypref tbbest.data: TBbest tcbest.data: TCbest erbest.data: ERbest divtb.mgt.data: TB/TBmgt divssb.mgt.data: SSB/SSBmgt divf.mgt.data: F/Fmgt diver.mgt.data: ER/ERmgt divbpref.mgt.data: B/Bmgtpref divupref.mgt.data: U/Umgtpref cpair.data: Cpair tac.data: TAC cadv.data: Cadvised survb.data: survB cpue.data: CPUE effort.data: EFFORT

what: Information Contained in the Stock Summary Documents
title: Tables and Stock Summary Description
text: specifies whether stock includes B/Bmsy, U/Umsy, B/Bmgt, U/Umgt time series data specifies whether TB SSB preferred, whether ER F preferred, types present

title: Tables and Stock Summary Description
text: Metadata (scientific name, area, management authority, assessor, assessment years) Reference points available stock Time series available stock Kobe plot (MSYpref) – Plots U/Umsy vs. B/Bmsy available, filling gaps U/Umgt B/Bmgt available Kobe plot (MGTpref) – Plots U/Umgt vs. B/Bmgt available, filling gaps U/Umsy B/Bmsy available Spawner Recruitment – Plots recruits vs. spawning-stock biomass Surplus Production – Plots annual surplus production vs. total biomass Total Biomass – Preferably plots recent TB time series assessment MSY, management target, limit reference point available, otherwise plots recent TB time series. Spawning stock biomass – Preferably plots recent SSB time series assessment MSY, management target, limit reference point available, otherwise plots recent SSB time series. Total abundance (numbers) – Preferably plots recent TN time series assessment MSY, management target, limit reference point available, otherwise plots recent TN time series. Fishing mortality (instantaneous rate) – Preferably plots recent F time series assessment MSY, management target, limit reference point available, otherwise plots recent F time series. Exploitation rate (annual proportion) – Preferably plots recent ER time series assessment MSY, management target, limit reference point available, otherwise plots recent ER time series. Recruits – Plots recent recruitment time series. known, year range recruitment deviates estimated assessment model shaded grey. TC, TL, RecC – Plots recent catch /landings well recreational catch MSY also available assessment. (year range moratoriums shaded grey available.) TAC, Cpair, Cadv – Plots recent total allowable catch landings (measures total quota), corresponding catch landings, corresponding scientifically advised catch available assessment. survB – Plots recent fishery-independent survey biomass time series. CPUE – Plots recent fishery-independent catch-per-unit-effort time series. EFFORT – Plots recent fishing effort time series. CdivMSY – Plots ratio recent catch time series MSY. MSY drawn assessment directly available, else calculated Bmsy Umsy reference points (including proxies) available.

title: Tables and Stock Summary Description
text: B – Biomass; may either total biomass spawning stock biomass Bmgt – Biomass management target reference point Bmsy – Biomass MSY Cadv – Scientifically advised catch CdivMSY – Catch divided MSY Cpair – Catch corresponding TAC Cadv CPUE – Catch per unit effort EFFORT – Measure fishing effort (depends fishery) ER – Exploitation rate (annual proportion) F – Fishing mortality (instantaneous rate) MSY – Maximum Sustainable Yield RecC – Recreational catch SSB – Spawning stock biomass survB – Survey biomass TAC – Total allowable catch TB – Total biomass TC – Total catch TL – Total landings TN – Total abundance; numbers U – Harvest rate; may either exploitation rate fishing mortality Umsy – Harvest rate MSY Umgt – Harvest rate management target reference point

title: Authors and Citation
text: Carl Boettiger. Author, copyright holder. Kshitiz Gupta. Author, maintainer, copyright holder. Sam Albers. Reviewer. Jamie Afflerbach. Reviewer. RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database. Data contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ricard, D., Minto, C., Jensen, O.P. Baum, J.K. (2012) "Evaluating knowledge base status commercially exploited marine species RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database". Fish Fisheries 13 (4) 380-398. DOI: 10.1111/j.1467-2979.2011.00435.x RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database. (2018). RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database v4.44 (Version v4.44) [Data set]. Zenodo. http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.2542919 RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database. (2018). RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database v4.41 (Version v4.41) [Data set]. Zenodo. http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.2542927 RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database. (2018). RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database v4.40 (Version v4.40) [Data set]. Zenodo. http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.2542935
code: @Article{,   title = {Evaluating the knowledge base and status of commercially exploited marine species with the RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database.},   author = {Daniel Ricard and Cóilín Minto and Olaf P. Jensen and Julia K. Baum},   journal = {Fish and Fisheries},   year = {2011},   doi = {10.1111/j.1467-2979.2011.00435.x}, } @Misc{,   author = {{RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database}},   title = {RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database v4.44},   year = {2018},   doi = {10.5281/zenodo.2542919},   url = {https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.2542919}, } @Misc{,   author = {{RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database}},   title = {RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database v4.41},   year = {2018},   doi = {10.5281/zenodo.2542927},   url = {https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.2542927}, } @Misc{,   author = {{RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database}},   title = {RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database v4.40},   year = {2018},   doi = {10.5281/zenodo.2542935},   url = {https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.2542935}, }

what: Download and Read RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database
title: Download and Read RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database
text: Authors: Kshitiz Gupta, Carl Boettiger License: MIT Package source code Github Submit Bugs feature requests ramlegacy R package supports caching reading different versions RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Data Base, online compilation stock assessment results commercially exploited marine populations around world. information database can found .

title: Download and Read RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database
text: Provides function download_ramlegacy(), download available versions RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Excel Database cache user’s computer serialized RDS objects. way version downloaded doesn’t need re-downloaded subsequent analysis. Supports reading specified tables tables cached version database function load_ramlegacy() Provides function ram_dir() view path location downloaded database cached.

title: Download and Read RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database
text: can install development version Github : ensure vignette installed along package make sure remove ---build-vignettes build_opts install_github

title: Download and Read RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database
text: Please see ramlegacy vignette detailed examples additional package functionality. Start loading package using library.

title: Download and Read RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database
text: download_ramlegacy() downloads specified version RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Excel Database saves RDS object user’s application data directory detected rappdirs package. location also load_ramlegacy() default look downloaded database. version specified download_ramlegacy defaults downloading current latest version (4.44) : latest versions RAM Legacy Database archived Zenodo older versions (v4.3, v3.0, v2.5, v2.0, v1.0) . ensure access older versions database download_ramlegacy supports downloading Github repository:
code: # downloads version 4.44 download_ramlegacy(version = "4.44") # downloads current latest version 4.44 download_ramlegacy() # downloads older version 4.3 download_ramlegacy(version = "4.3")

title: Download and Read RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database
text: specified version database downloaded cached local machine download_ramlegacy can call load_ramlegacy obtain list specific tables/tables version database. version specified tables load_ramlegacy defaults returning list containing specified dataframes latest version (currently 4.44). version tables specified load_ramlegacy defaults returning list containing dataframes latest version (currently 4.44) learn different tables present database, various acronyms mean different stock summaries accompanying databases please see page.
code: # get a list containing area and bioparams tables from # version 4.3 of the database load_ramlegacy(version = "4.3", tables = c("area", "bioparams"))  # get a list containing area and bioparams tables from version 4.44 # of the database load_ramlegacy(version = "4.44", tables = c("area", "bioparams"))  # if tables is specified but version is not then the function defaults # to returning a list containing the specified tables from the current # latest version 4.44 load_ramlegacy(tables = c("area", "bioparams"))  # since both tables and version are not specified the function returns # a list containing all the tables from the current latest version 4.44 load_ramlegacy()

title: Download and Read RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database
text: view exact path certain version database downloaded cached download_ramlegacy can run ram_dir(vers = 'version'), specifying version number inside function call:
code: # download version 4.44 download_ramlegacy(version = "4.44")  # view the location where version 4.44 of the database was # downloaded and cached ram_dir(vers = "4.44")

title: Download and Read RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database
text: ramlegacy Sean Anderson namesake package appears stalled project Github (last updated 9 months ago). However, unlike package supports downloading reading Excel version database, Sean Anderson’s project downloads Microsoft Access version converts local sqlite3 database. RAMlegacyr RAMlegacyr older package last updated 2015. Similar Sean Anderson’s project, package seems R interface Microsoft Access version RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database provides set functions using RPostgreSQL connect database.

title: Download and Read RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database
text: Current older versions RAM Legacy Database archived Zenodo, version unique DOI. suggested format citing data : RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database. 2018. Version 4.44-assessment-. Released 2018-12-22. Accessed [Date accessed YYYY-MM-DD]. Retrieved DOI:10.5281/zenodo.2542919. primary publication describing RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database, suggested citation general use : Ricard, D., Minto, C., Jensen, O.P. Baum, J.K. (2012) Evaluating knowledge base status commercially exploited marine species RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database. Fish Fisheries 13 (4) 380-398. DOI: 10.1111/j.1467-2979.2011.00435.x Several publications relied RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Database.

what: Download RAM Legacy Excel Database — download_ramlegacy
title: Download RAM Legacy Excel Database — download_ramlegacy
text: Downloads specified version RAM Legacy Stock Assessment Excel Database RDS object local directory specified ram_dir. function check version requested already exists user's computer prompts user download unless `overwrite = TRUE` case function download version without displaying prompt. function also supports downloading older versions (1.0, 2.0, 2.5, 3.0, 4.3) [github repo](www.github.com/kshtzgupta1/ramlegacy-assets)

title: Download RAM Legacy Excel Database — download_ramlegacy
code: download_ramlegacy(version = NULL, ram_path = NULL,   ram_url = "https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.2542918",   overwrite = FALSE, quiet = FALSE)

title: Download RAM Legacy Excel Database — download_ramlegacy
text: version character vector length 1 specifying version number database downloaded. writing package, available versions "1.0","2.0", "2.5", "3.0", "4.3", "4.40", "4.41", "4.44". version argument specified defaults latest version (currently latest version "4.44"). ram_path string specifying path local directory database downloaded. default path set location provided rappdirs package can viewed calling ram_dir. Although recommended approach download_ramlegacy supports downloading user-specified path. ram_url string. default set Zenodo url database. Please pass url ram_url. overwrite argument relevant trying re-download version already present locally rappdirs directory. overwrite = TRUE user encounter interactive prompt confirms whether overwrite version present locally. quiet TRUE, suppress status messages

title: Download RAM Legacy Excel Database — download_ramlegacy
code: # \donttest{ # \dontshow{ Sys.setenv(RAM_HOME = tempfile()) # } # download version 4.44 download_ramlegacy(version = "4.44") #> ★ Downloading...this may take a while #> ★ Finished Downloading. Now unzipping it... #> ★ Saving the unzipped database as RDS object... #> ✔ Version 4.44 successfully downloaded.  # download version 1.0 download_ramlegacy(version = "1.0") #> ★ Downloading...this may take a while #> ★ Finished downloading v1.0. Saving the database as RDS object... #> ✔ Version 1.0 successfully downloaded. # \dontshow{ Sys.setenv(RAM_HOME = tempfile()) # } # If version not specified then default # to latest version (currently 4.44) download_ramlegacy() #> ★ Downloading...this may take a while #> ★ Finished Downloading. Now unzipping it... #> ★ Saving the unzipped database as RDS object... #> ✔ Version 4.44 successfully downloaded. # }

what: Read-in dataframes from downloaded RAM Legacy Database — load_ramlegacy
title: Read-in dataframes from downloaded RAM Legacy Database — load_ramlegacy
text: Returns list specific dataframes list  dataframes present requested version database.

title: Read-in dataframes from downloaded RAM Legacy Database — load_ramlegacy
code: load_ramlegacy(version = NULL, tables = NULL, ram_path = NULL)

title: Read-in dataframes from downloaded RAM Legacy Database — load_ramlegacy
text: version character vector length 1 specifying version number database. writing package, available versions "1.0", "2.0", "2.5", "3.0", "4.3", "4.40", "4.41" "4.44". version argument specified defaults newest version (v4.44). tables character vector specifying names particular dataframes load specified version. specified list containing dataframes within requested version returned. description different tables present database please see . ram_path path local directory specified version RAM Legacy Stock Excel Assessment Database downloaded. default path set within rappdirs directory can viewed using calling function ram_dir specifying version number inside function call. Although recommended approach load_ramlegacy supports reading database's dataframes user-specified path provided database present specified path rds object.

title: ramlegacy 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-05-16 Removed loading behavior library(ramlegacy) leaving loading solely load_ramlegacy Instead assigning tables global environment load_ramlegacy now just returns list tables can specified tables argument. Modified download_ramlegacy load_ramlegacy default still download read dataframes rappdirs directory functions now also support downloading location chosen user reading location.

title: ramlegacy 0.2.0
text: Releases numbered following semantic versioning format: <major>.<minor>.<patch> constructed following guidelines: Breaking backward compatibility bumps major (resets minor patch) New additions without breaking backward compatibility bumps minor (resets patch) Bug fixes misc changes bumps patch Following RStudio convention, .99 appended patch number indicate development version Github. version Coming Github now use .99 extension, never appear version number package CRAN.
